00031 NITF_CXX_GUARD
00040 typedef struct _nitf_TRECursor
00041 {
00042     /* DO NOT TOUCH THESE! */
00043     int numItems;               /* holds the number of descPtr items */
00044     int index;                  /* holds the current index to process */
00045     int looping;                /* keeps track of how deep we are in the loops */
00046     nitf_IntStack *loop;        /* holds loopcount for each level of loops */
00047     nitf_IntStack *loop_idx;    /* holds the indexes for each level of loops (arrays) */
00048     nitf_IntStack *loop_rtn;    /* holds the endloop bookmark for each level of loops */
00049     nitf_TRE *tre;              /* the TRE associated with this cursor */
00050     nitf_TREDescription *end_ptr; /* holds a pointer to the end description */
00051 
00052     /* YOU CAN REFER TO THE MEMBERS BELOW IN YOUR CODE */
00053     nitf_TREDescription *prev_ptr; /* holds the previous description */
00054     nitf_TREDescription *desc_ptr;      /* pointer to the current nitf_TREDescription */
00055     char tag_str[256];          /* holds the fully qualified tag name of the current tag */
00056     int length;                 /* the length of the field
00057                                      * This should be used over the TREDescription length because
00058                                      * the field may need to be computed. This will contain the
00059                                      * actual, possibly computed length. */
00060 }
00061 nitf_TRECursor;
